damage businessmen and officials said they told reuter correspondents asian capitals move against japan might boost protectionist sentiment the and lead curbs american imports their products but some exporters said that while the conflict would hurt them the long run the short term tokyo loss might their gain the has said will impose mln dlrs tariffs imports japanese electronics goods april tariffs remain place for any length time beyond few months will mean the complete erosion exports goods subject tariffs the said tom murtha stock analyst the tokyo office broker james capel and taiwan association said the trade dispute between the and japan might also lead pressure south korea whose chief exports are similar those japan last year south korea had trade surplus billion dlrs with the from billion dlrs malaysia trade officers and businessmen said tough curbs against japan might allow hard hit producers semiconductors third countries expand their sales the hong kong where newspapers serious for hong kong the disadvantage action restraining trade said the last year was hong kong biggest export market accounting for over pct domestically produced exports the australian government awaiting the outcome trade talks between the and japan with interest and concern industry minister john button said canberra last friday this kind deterioration trade relations between two countries which are major trading partners ours very serious matter button said said australia concerns centred coal and beef australia two largest exports japan and also significant exports that country meanwhile japanese diplomatic manoeuvres solve the trade stand off continue japan ruling liberal democratic party yesterday outlined package economic measures boost the japanese economy the measures proposed include large supplementary budget and record public works spending the first half the financial year they also call for stepped spending emergency measure stimulate the economy despite prime takeovers and fairer treatment for all shareholders speaking the national association manufacturers proxmire said recent insider trading stock scandals increased the chance that congress will act curb abuses are proposing legislation that would provide for more disclosure would fairer all shareholders and would insure that takeovers are properly financed said among the provisions the bill would reduce the threshold for notifying the securities and exchange commission that investor group has acquired percentage stock company three pct from the current five pct threshold within days proxmire said addition there would pre notificaton requirement that investor intended aquire three pct that would have filed with the sec proxmire said the pre notification requirement was meant prevent arbitragers from having jump the general public knowing about coming takeover attempts proxmire said would call for extending the period that tender offer must kept open under the williams act business days from the current business days his bill would provide for private suits the acquiring company violated the time period the tender offer correct abuses the financing takeovers proxmire said the legislation would aim insuring current margin requirments are properly enforced the federal reserve board has pct margin requirement for purchasing stock but proxmire said not generally enforced hostile takeovers rather the groups individuals leading takeover declare that they can raise the capital for takeover without actually putting any their own money proxmire said said his bill would allow private suits for damages for failure meet the federal reserve pct margin requirements the bill also would require more disclose when several investors form alliance hostile takeover when pickens and icahn get together want people know about proxmire said proxmire said favored the approach used britain towards two tiered tender offers that insures that all shareholders recieve equal treatment said expected amendments the bill also would cover defensive mechanisms such green mail and poison pills proxmire said intended introduce his bill later this month and predicted the senate committee would act this spring said was hopeful congress could pass bill this year reuter

money-supply	fed heller says monetary growth slower robert heller member the federal reserve board said expects more modest levels growth the money supply this year view this would not only logical but also most desireable development said speech prepared for delivery economic forum chapman college orange calif text was released washington said the effect lower inflation and financial deregulation monetary aggregates was now largely finished consequently monetary growth may return more modest levels heller said noted growth the money supply slowed after mid january would not surprised all the monetary aggregates were grow rather slowly during the balance the year well added heller said there was danger renewed price inflation the pricing behavior american producers response price increases their foreign competitors will crucial for our economic future said widespread domestic price rises response rising import prices would generalize the inflationary forces emanating from the foreign trade sector and might not gain more market share for producers return the stagflation the late may well the result such behavior pattern heller warned said the federal reserve will have disciplined our conduct monetary policy heller said said the government should also exercise fiscal discipline and cut the deficit spending restraint rather than new taxes the imposition new taxes would tend rekindle inflation and certainly would not make more competitive international markets heller said said the economy should expand nearly three pct during aided higher exports europe and canada free trade agreement currently being negotiated with canada would exceedingly helpful allowing american producers compete more effectively that country heller said reuter

trade	deficit cuts seen unable cure trade deficit financial analysts say they are pleased with congressional moves trim next year federal budget deficit but believe the actions will little help improve the trade deficit buoy the economy the house representatives expected vote tomorrow approve trillion dollar budget blueprint for the coming fiscal year that reduces the deficit billion dlrs similarly the senate budget committee has approved plan that would cut federal red ink about billion dlrs next year terms the economy billion dlrs infinitesimal cuts this magnitude will have little impact the economy and the trade deficit said stanley collander touche ross federal budget policy analyst best will have small positive effect collander said interview federal reserve board chairman paul volcker has repeatedly told congress that cutting federal red ink would long way help reduce the massive trade deficit and also help ease some the downward pressure the value the dollar the government has attempted remedy the trade imbalance driving down the value the dollar but volcker has warned that further fall the dollar value fraught with danger such decline has said could refuel inflation imported goods become more expensive and chase away foreign capital needed finance the federal budget deficit addition february officials meeting with other major industrialized nations paris agreed that the value the dollar had dropped enough and that world exchange rates should stabilized around current levels part that agreement japan and west germany agreed take steps stimulate their economies and the united states agreed cut its budget deficit the alternative driving down the dollar any further way deal with the trade deficit volcker said recently reduce consumption particularly federal spending you don deal with the budget deficit everything else you going counterproductive volcker said recent testimony before the senate banking committee volcker also said would prefer further tighten the government purse strings than have the fed tighten the credit supply action was needed fight inflationary pressures assure the continued flow foreign capital into the united states analysts say that fed tightening now could choke off the current modest economic expansion and threaten recession kemper financial services economist john silvia stressed that any deficit reduction was better than none but said the size the cuts under consideration were not enough give the federal reserve board the flexibility needs steer the economy keep the value the dollar from plunging further world exchange markets there doubt that some deficit reduction helps but your objective stabilize the dollar and perserve the fed flexibility conduct monetary policy then the answer not enough silvia told reuters the trade deficit has become one the government most vexing and persistent problems the deficit was billion dlrs and there yet little indication that this year figure will any lower though administration officials have predicted will drop about billion dlrs year end the past volcker has joked that never lost sleep worrying whether congress would cut too much fat from the federal budget the other hand also has made clear not attached the gradually declining deficit ceilings set for the period last year gramm rudman balanced budget law while the new law set ceiling billion dlrs for next year federal deficit both the house and senate budget committees have conceded that their budget plans would fall short the deficit reduction goal about billion dlrs for political reasons billion dlrs about the most you going get out congress the present time said touche ross collander something more than that would extraordinary remarkable and very very difficult collander said the real danger for congress was end short the deficit reduction goal set its budget panels extent this has become the minimum acceptable reduction level explained anything less than that will now look like failure wall street the budget plan now under debate the house floor would lower estimated billion dlr deficit for the year beginning october one about billion dlrs cutting defense and domestic programs billion dlrs from their anticipated spending levels for next year the senate budget committee has called for deficit nearly billion dlrs with about billion dlrs new taxes and about the same amount spending cuts reuter

money-fx	finance ministers agree need for stability finance ministers from seven major industrialized nations agreed the need stabilize currencies current levels but said more action was needed reduce trade imbalances and sustain economic growth communique issued after four hour meeting the treasury that ended last night the ministers said the value the dollar and other currencies was basically correct now and they welcomed new measures planned the japanese boost their economy west german finance minister gerhard stoltenberg called good meeting and brief remarks exchanged with reporters other ministers seemed pleased with its outcome shortly after the communique was issued and just foreign exchange trading opened tokyo the bank japan intervened again prevent the yen rising too quickly the communique said the ministers and governors reaffirmed the commitment the cooperative approach agreed the recent paris meeting they agreed however that further actions will essential resist rising protectionist pressures sustain global economic expansion and reduce trade imbalances welcomed the plans set this week the japan ruling liberal democratic party stimulate its economy with what the communique termed extraordinary and urgent measures including unprecedented front end loading public works expenditures the meeting the called group seven brought together ministers and central bank governors the seven major industrial democracies the united states japan west germany france britain italy and canada the communique said the ministers reaffirmed the commitment cooperation reached meeting february paris when they had agreed stabilize foreign exchange rates the then current levels the weeks that followed the dollar continued fall against the japanese yen despite massive dollar purchases the bank japan and other central banks and now trading around postwar lows japan has come under growing criticism from both the united states and european countries for its only modest efforts open its markets outside competition and reduce its exports the communique said japan affirmed its intention open domestic markets foreign goods and services but did not elaborate said the officials reaffirmed the view that around current levels their currencies are within ranges broadly consistent with economic fundamentals and the basic policy intentions outlined the louvre meeting reuter

countries they had hoped that new vitality the industrial countries brought sharp decline oil prices would assist their economic recovery and help them cope with growing mounds debt imf officials discussing their outlook said they believed the industrial country economies would move annual growth rate three pct the end the decade economic analysts and the imf have been saying for some time speaking journalists one day after the group seven countries reaffirmed goals set paris six weeks ago said central banks would continue intervene and when necessary said the countries were concerned that japan more stimulate domestic demand and welcomed measures outlined japanese finance minister kiichi miyazawa yesterday lawson said was still worried about the risk simultaneous recession the united states japan and west germany though less than when gave his march budget speech the british parliament anything little bit less concerned but there still risk said asked the united states should consider increasing interest rates support the dollar said there need for changes relative interest rates doesn need rise interest rates the united states lawson said there was some concern expressed yesterday meetings the slow progress the united states had made reducing its budget deficit believe there will some worthwhile progress reducing the deficit this year the important thing that continue year after year lawson said the february louvre accord called for efforts stabilize currencies then current exchange rates the six weeks that followed the japanese yen continued rise against the dollar despite massive central bank intervention asked whether this intervention was sign weakness the louvre accord said don think there had been intervention you would have called that sign weakness although intervention could cause inflation lawson said the world does not appear inflationary mode but one has vigilant said yesterday statement which affirmed that current levels exchange rates were appropriate had been carefully worded know what mean and all mean the same thing said lawson said financial markets seem believe that japanese measures outlined the louvre accord were the source weakness for that agreement therefore the countries welcomed miyazawa presentation plans for supplemental budget stimulate domestic demand they particularly welcomed the goal immediate increase public works spending but lawson said the package also involved second stage increase expenditures during the second half this year reuter

money-fx	treasury baker says rate shifts orderly treasury secretary james baker said that changes exchange rates have generally been orderly and have improved the prospects for reduction external imbalances more sustainable levels remarks before the imf policy making interim committee baker reiterated group seven statement last night that the substantial exchange rate changes since the plaza agreement months ago have now brought currencies within ranges broadly consistent with economic fundamentals baker said these exchange rate shifts have generally been orderly and have improved prospects for the reduction external imbalances more sustainable levels they are today the trade and current account imbalances simply are not sustainable baker told the ministers said that the reagan administration was resisting strong domestic pressure for trade protection and was working closely with the congress crafting trade bill while cannot yet sure the outcome are doing what can ensure that the bill not protectionist said baker also urged the international monetary fund executive board review possible modifications the fund compensatory financing facility before the annual meeting this fall should pay particular attention the lack continuing conditionality associated with the use the cff and whether shortfalls export earnings are indeed temporary said reuter

for canadian exports the united states far the country largest market expected strong result projected rise american consumer spending and the relatively low value the canadian currency maintain what money-fx	treasury baker says system needs stability treasury secretary james baker said the floating exchange rate system has not been effective had been hoped promoting stability and preventing imbalances from emerging the global economy remarks before the afternoon session the international monetary fund interim committee baker said was not suggesting that the system should abandoned but suggest said that need something give more stability and keep headed the right direction when the wind shifts said that indicators can serve kind compass but added that structural indicators can help focus attention some policies baker however said the imf needs move beyond macroeconomic indicators and find structural indicators that can help focus attention some the policies specific relevance the imbalances face today the treasury secretary said that indicators should given more prominent role the annual economic reviews article consultations that the fund performs baker also told the policy making group that was time for the imf adopt earlier recommendations making imf surveillance more relevant national policymakers and the public particular urge increased publicity for imf appraisals developed article consultations the use follow reports country actions implement imf recommendations and greater use special consultation procedures said baker emphasized that indicators were device for moving beyond rhetoric action said they provide more structure the system and induce more discipline and peer pressure into the process policy coordination said the fund procedures for surveillance need reviewed and updated reflect the use indicators this should matter priority for the executive board said baker also urged the fund develop alternative medium term economic scenarios for countries that can help focus even more clearly the most important imbalances identifying options for addressing them and analyzing the implications these options said also that further work should done finding paths that lead toward possible medium term objectives are take effective remedial action when there are significant deviations from intended course then must have more definitive ways indentifying the right course for key variables said reuter

maturity years and are entitled sinking fund commencing the year designed retire pct the issue before maturity borg warner will also redeem all its outstanding dlrs cumulative preferred stock series tax cuts planned for their joint spring report the institutes were divided about growth forecasts with three predicting two pct expansion and the other two only one pct growth gross national product grew pct last year but the report said all the institutes believed that more must done produce dynamic growth that more additional jobs can created the institutes said any step which improved basic economic conditions should taken quickly possible from this point view the tax reform planned for should brought forward the government plans gross tax reductions billion marks part the major tax reform the net tax relief from the tax reform will amount billion marks however the institutes criticised the government not only for the timing the reform but also because the question its financing had been left open the government has not specified how the remaining billion marks the tax reduction package will paid for though has said wants cut state subsidies the institutes said this lack clarity from bonn had caused uncertainty among companies and households what exactly they would receive from the tax reform and urged quick decision from the government they also said the government should reduce tax preferences which would simplify the fiscal system urged restriction state spending and called for increase value added tax the institutes also criticised bonn for increasing subsidies time further reductions had been pledged they referred specifically doubling special writedowns for small and medium sized companies announced package tax adjustments planned for and described this increase subsidies the institutes said total subsidies including tax preferences had reached billion marks and risen further since then given the scope these subsidies should possible despite major political difficulties finance the tax reform cutting state handouts the institutes said that the government raised value added tax other indirect taxes large portion the positive effects resulting from lower taxes would lost the report also noted that the government was progressing only slowly with its plans privatise state companies and said more deregulation was needed the would try limit its current account surplus around five billion dlrs year for the next few years although trade volume would continue grow this will gradually reduce the ratio the surplus gnp gross would plus said christopher chew brokerage firm james capel and the ultimate cost the existing system food prices twice those europe and two three times those the the analysts said spending food accounts for about one quarter the average household budget and roughly pct the gross national product gnp according study chew reducing these prices could increase household spending power five pct his study said the money could spent products which would have more direct impact boosting domestic growth added there lot slack government official tokyo said all that money could spent something money wasted changing tax laws encourage city residents who only farm weekends put their land for sale for residential development would also give boost domestic spending economists said housing the burden trade friction and economic restructuring away from the manufacturing sector and onto the farm sector employers groups also want change you really want expand domestic demand the way not several city votes due the pattern constituency borders the ldp already political trouble over its tax reform plan and does not want raise another sticky issue soon the analysts said consumer groups federal reserve has started tighten its grip credit economists said clear that the fed has firmed somewhat discount window borrowings net free reserves the fed funds rate average and the pattern reserve additions are all consistent with modest tightening said dana johnson first chicago corp johnson and several other economists now estimate that the fed funds rate should trade between and pct discount window borrowings the week wednesday were mln dlrs day producing daily average for the two week statement period mln dlrs the highest since the week december and from mln dlrs previously moreover banks were forced borrow huge billion dlrs from the fed wednesday the highest daily total this year even though unexpectedly low treasury balances the fed that day left banks with over two billion dlrs more reserves than the fed had anticipated however economists said almost certain that the fed aiming for much lower discount window borrowings than witnessed this week they pointed two factors that may have forced banks scramble for reserves the end the week first economists now expect money supply for the week ended april rise staggering billion dlrs partly reflecting the parking checking accounts the proceeds from stock market sales and mutual fund redemptions pay annual income taxes banks checking account liabilities rise the reserves that they are required hold deposit the fed required reserves did indeed rise sharply billion dlrs day the two weeks ended wednesday but economists said the fed may not have believed the magnitude the projected surge until late the week and started add reserves too late second apparent shortage treasury bills apparently left wall street dealers with too little collateral with which enagage repurchase agreements with the fed economists said thus although there were billion dlrs repos outstanding wednesday night the fed may have wanted add even more reserves but was prevented from doing not all inconceivable that the fed didn add much they wanted because the shortage collateral said ward mccarthy merrill lynch economics inc mccarthy estimated that the fed now targetting discount window borrowings about mln dlrs day equivalent fed funds rate around pct after citing the reasons why the fed probably has not tightened credit the degree suggested the data economists said the fact that the fed delayed arranging overnight injections reserves until the last day the statement period was good sign more restrictive policy jeffrey leeds chemical bank had not been convinced that the fed was tightening policy but after reviewing today figures said fair say that the fed may moving toward slightly less accommodative reserve posture leeds expects fed funds trade between and pct and said the fed unlikely raise the discount rate unless the dollar fall gathers pace johnson first chicago agreed citing political opposition washington dollar defense package time when congress sees further dollar depreciation the key trade	study says tariffs and quotas could backfire the use tariffs and quotas reduce the flow foreign goods into the united states will little cut the nation swelling trade deficit government study said fact the federal trade commission ftc report said such protectionist policies could make products less competitive the world marketplace raising the cost imported products that are exported different forms such policies are much more likely hurt rather than help the productive capabilities the economy said the page report written ftc economists john hilke and philip nelson blamed the rising trade shortfall which climbed record billion dlrs last year shifting currency exchange rates and growing consumer demand other factors commonly blamed for the deficit such foreign trade practices deteriorating industrial competitiveness high labour costs and government restrictions mergers added little the problem said although each industry competitiveness affects the level imports and exports that industry general find that there have been significant industry specific changes affecting competitiveness that would explain the increase the overall trade deficit the study said the extent any government action needed deal with the trade deficits policies should focus economy wide phenomena such exchange rates and relative economic growth the ftc study said supporting its conclusion that broad based economic shifts were the cause the increase the trade deficit the report said found that nearly all industries lost some domestic market share foreign competitors the also said found fairly direct relationship between the increased trade deficit and the influence shifting currency exchange rates economic growth and domestic demand for goods and services which has outpaced foreign consumer demand the study examined seven factors which have been commonly blamed for the trade deficit foreign government subsidies and trade barriers protect foreign industries lack investment industry declining research and development industry high labour costs union work rules the oil prices rises the and antitrust regulations each case the study found little evidence that the factor had any impact the trade deficit reuter

which has been operating since london metal exchange lme tin trading ceased october dealers here will also want see how acceptable foreign metal will the new market and what sort demand develops for forward deliveries there also view among european traders that while the proposed kuala lumpur tin futures market would provide another useful reference point market inaugurated the malaysian government the past viewed major player times the trade would make participants uncomfortable some traders expressed preference for resumption trading the london metal exchange but they added that tonne during however the trend was reversed following strong upswing sterling versus the dollar and values fell back briefly stg last month after approaching stg december the decline accelerated producers who had sold very little metal the higher levels became competitive sellers there was also lack significant demand from major steel mills who made large purchases prior the new year traders overlook poehl past adviser former social democrat chancellor willy brandt and top aide helmut schmidt when was finance minister bankers said was schmidt who chancellor appointed poehl his present job policies prevent inflation catching hold older germans can remember two bouts galloping inflation this century but with consumer prices falling for much and inflation negligible far this year poehl thinks safe relax the monetary reins little and concentrate the dangers the german economy bloated exchange rate the opinion that efforts stabilise the dollar mark rate have reached high priority also for the bundesbank because further massive revaluation the mark would endanger the economy west germany told business journalists frankfurt recently ute geipel head research citibank says that poehl reappointment would guarantee flexible monetary policy poehl policy has always been policy which does not focus rigidly domestic factors but also the external economy she said economist german bank the united states stop talking down the dollar for poehl the significance the february louvre accord was that the united states agreed join efforts stabilise currencies the louvre accord was greeted with scepticism currency dealers who said they would soon put the test but fact the dollar has been relatively stable since the pact this because the markets know perhaps because they don know what the central banks can poehl says intervention currency markets which can quickly turn rates round making speculator position worthless poehl was born and worked financial journalist the before starting his ministerial career relaxed sun tanned figure who enjoys cracking jokes over glass beer hardly stereotype central banker also keen sportsman who likes watch football and play golf poehl says currency market intervention cannot substitute for correct economic policies exchange rates are imbalanced but you can achieve enormous effect with small amount you strike the right moment said added that the move which sparked record single day plunge the local stock market would limit their ability lend foreign exchange importers and exporters foreign exchange borrowings local and foreign converted into local dollars boosting money supply time booming exports money supply rose seasonally adjusted pct the year end april raising fears higher inflation march the central bank clamped tight crude	opec differentials not seen posing major problems some opec states are unhappy about the prices assigned their crude oil but this should not pose great problems when the group reviews its six month old price and output pact vienna next week oil analysts say they said nigeria which holds the opec conference presidency and qatar probably have the biggest grievances about price differentials making some their crudes uncompetitive there has also been speculation japanese traders that opec might want mark prices high sulphur heavy crudes correspond with greater demand and higher fuel oil prices but most experts agree that major overhaul price differentials unlikely avoid giving the market signals dent opec new unity all opec members can make good case for changing differentials said one analyst with major oil company but the end the day the attitude going leave well alone and little nothing likely altered iran libya and saudi arabia are among those who also saw sales problems earlier this year traders say but diminished customer resistance fixed prices and some cases marketing incentives have helped their sales some producers can sell uncompetitively priced crudes means discounts processing deals selling them alongside better priced grades package many opec crudes are seen reasonably priced least for some part the year but many experts say opec should change prices quarterly monthly match seasonal demand for fuel oil rich heavy crudes and gasoline rich lighter grades its last meeting december opec agreed reintroduce fixed prices from february around dlr per barrel reference point official prices had been effectively dropped when members offered discounts attract customers opec also decided limit first half output mln bpd and proposed ceilings mln for the third quarter and mln for the fourth analysts expect will now extend raise slightly the current ceiling for the coming months spot market and netback values for some crudes not mirror official prices but opec will probably keep the dlr target and most make minimal changes differentials analysts say the dlr figure based basket six opec and one non opec crudes opec assigned prices its other key export crudes with dlr gap between the heaviest and lightest extra heavy crudes were among those left out industry estimates vary the proportion opec oil exports actually sold official prices several experts say only one quarter one third the total fact sells official prices with some the rest included processing barter deals sold the form refined products problems with the new structure appeared earlier this year when some producers output fell due customer reluctance pay the new prices nigeria especially found its gasoline rich bonny light crude now opec highest priced grade dlrs barrel was uncompetitive the spot market against britain brent february and march nigeria production shrank below its mln bpd opec quota spot prices have since revived due partly seasonal demand for gasoline and its output has risen some experts feel bonny light still overvalued and say its price should cut between cts one dlr barrel but mehdi varzi chief oil analyst with london kleinwort grieveson securities veg-oil	commission defends oils and fats tax spokesman for the european community commission defended the controversial plan for levy oils and fats saying that consumers would have help alleviate the surplus problem paying the proposed tax norbert tanghe head division the commission directorate general for agriculture told the antwerp oils and fats contact days the commission firmly believes that the sacrifices which would undergone community producers the oils and fats sector would justify asking consumers make appropriate contribution solving the serious problem within that sector paying levy the proposed tax necessary because the level budgetary costs resulting from olive oil and oilseeds production has become unacceptable tanghe said recent estimates put these costs billion european currency units and they would rise another billion ecus said the community standstill agreements with spain and portugal end and the would then feel the full impact its enlargement the commission has proposed several cost and production cutting measures which include the introduction maximum guaranteed quantity system added under the commission system for stabilising consumer prices the oils and fats sector reference price ecus per tonne for refined soy oil would introduced tanghe said consumer prices could raised lowered regulatory amount when market prices are below above this level said the revenue generated charging regulatory amount would used finance the common agricultural policy oils and fats regime the commission believes that hostile reactions the proposed tax have for the most part been based incomplete insufficiently thorough analysis the proposal said tanghe said the proposed system conforms with general agreement tariffs and trade gatt rules would not discriminatory because would applied domestic and imported products and past experience showed would not cause any decline consumption oils and fats produced oilseeds would not benefit more than they under present aid arrangements said the competitiveness between different oils whether produced imported would remain unchanged and quantities imported from third countries would not affected the tax tanghe said the proposed system would not alter the nations requirements far imports are concerned since the overall effect would stabilise community production levels without affecting demand said one the proposal objectives maintain current import levels said imports soybeans would unaffected because they are imported primarily satisfy the cakes and meals requirements which are not covered the stabilising system furthermore more than half the oil produced from imported beans exported third countries tanghe added reuter

slightly about tonnes from record low tonnes are convinced that the end the financial year copper production could well over tonnes due greater availability spares and equipment zccm official said with peak output tonnes five year production and investment plan launched zccm being funded the european community the african development bank and the world bank the plan foresees the shutdown some have far been channelled into the industry bid improve efficiency and profitability under the five year restructuring plan company officials said although reserves were being depleted zambia could continue produce copper beyond the end the century though lower levels production industry sources said zccm projected pre tax profit for the financial year ended march would around mln kwacha but with the current mineral export tax level being levied net loss likely registered zccm recorded net loss mln kwacha compared with net profit mln kwacha the year before under the foreign exchange auction system introduced zccm profits from its foreign exchange earnings rose the value the kwacha fell the dollar from just over two the dollar but may president kenneth kaunda abolished the auctioning system inspired the international monetary fund and announced zambia would pursue alone economic strategy based national resources zccm officials are still cautious over what effects the and third the zccm hierarchy told reuters some analysts believe the new officially fixed exchange rate eight kwacha the dollar will hit zccm export profits most specialists have talked tell the break said reflects the increasingly competitive nature the home mortgage business while fixed rate mortgages are uncommon the they were the mainstay the business the until only few years ago but the early them retain their accounts result hundreds institutions collapsed were forced merge the survivors decided offer mortgages whose rates would move line with the cost funds very much have the example the thrifts mind said spokesman for abbey national building society explaining why his institution for the time being only offering variable rate mortgages the rash advertising solicit new business has helped homebuyers become even choosier about loans and lenders concede they are being forced undercut each other still more sharp cuts variable rate mortgages announced earlier this week the nation two largest building societies and national westminster bank plc reflect growing competition for new business officials all three institutions said the fixed rate mortgages offer carry interest rates even below those the variable rate loans course they are less profitable than other variable rate mortgages said spokesman for midland bank plc which earlier this year said earmarked mln dlrs for fixed rate new mortgage loans but said the bank willing offer less profitable loans because was just another way attract people our mortgage product trustee savings bank plc tsb was offering five year within five days the bank loaned the equivalent pct its volume short the appeal fixed rate mortgages that they offer opportunity gamble the direction interest rates interest rates fall after the mortgage made the lender earning above average return assets but interest rates rise the homebuyer who has won the benefit cheap money household mortgage had planned offer year fixed rate mortgage after the june elections the assumption that conservative party victory would help money market rates fall further according duncan young managing director young explained that the company had planned protect itself against the chance rising interest rates buying complicated hedging instrument but money market rates have risen contrary expectations and the company has shelved its plans for the time being said money market rates were too high arrange both the mortgages and hedge profitably however said that when the household mortgage does make fixed rate mortgages likely securitise them this means bundling different mortgages together resemble bond and selling them investor for technical reasons securitisation simpler and more efficient with fixed rate rather than with floating rate averages and would give brazil the world biggest coffee producer unchanged quota for the remaining two years the current coffee agreement van horick said accepted the consumer and producer members the ico the formula could also basis for negotiating new agreement van horick said coffee quotas were suspended february last year when prices shot fears drought induced crop disaster brazil although proposal leaves very little object van horick said the existing quota system far too rigid and does not reflect supply and demand reality said our formula builds flexibility into the system and will benefit almost everyone although full implications the new formula have still worked out initial estimates suggest countries such colombia kenya indonesia and costa rica would get slightly higher quotas while others such the ivory coast salvador and nicaragua would lose quota share van horick said because the proposal provides that future quota distribution must reflect current demand and hinder its ability repay foreign debt mario rodriguez montero president organization american states special committee trade said was aware the large trade deficit but added the region should not the one affected the trade bills said the causes the deficit were the strong dollar and the budget deficit and regrettable solve trade bill that would only serve private interests rodriguez made the comment news conference after two days meetings with officials trade bills now congress that are designed reduce the trade deficit which last year hit record billion dlrs congressional observers say the bills are aimed mainly japan taiwan south korea and few other nations with large annual trade surpluses with the united states mexico brazil and venezuela are the only latin nations with large trade surpluses last year with the united states but even mexico with the largest had surplus only billion dlrs against japan billion dlrs the european community has also opposed the bills rodriguez said the latin and caribbean nations backed the reagan administration opposition many the sections the legislation including those curb imports and require retaliation for foreign unfair trade practices told reporters the committee would likely mount campaign fight the legislation when comes for debate the senate floor expected next week rodriguez said the region needs trade continue development hope this need will not affected negatively trade legislation rodriguez said need keep the market opens especially the market obtain the necessary foreign exchange not only service the acq	new leader coming sec challenging era president reagan nominee top policeman for the nation securities markets will inherit agency challenged insider trading scandal wild stock price gyrations and host uncertainties stemming from the globalization financial markets david ruder year old republican law professor northwestern university evanston ill was named thursday the chairman the five member securities and exchange commission confirmed the senate expected will succeed john shad who left the agency earlier this week after record six years chairman become ambassador the netherlands the sec has been the limelight for the past year its investigators have probed into the most colossal insider trading scandal ever uncovered wall street the investigation which still active mushroomed recent months growing number well known traders and prominent investment banking firms have been charged with wrongdoing the pace the probe picked markedly november after ivan boesky one wall street most successful stock speculators agreed cooperate with government investigators and pay record mln dlrs penalties and illegal profits after being charged with insider trading but the agency also wrestling with vexing new phenomenon huge and rapid swings stock prices spurred computer driven trading strategies that span markets securities options and futures the price gyrations have combined with rising trading volumes bring unprecedented volatility some securities markets the same time the sec being pressed some lawmakers put stop abusive tactics corporate takeover contests unrelenting wave such takeovers steadily reshapes the corporate landscape and the agency being pushed and foreign exchanges intent expansion lay the regulatory groundwork for international securities marketplace which trading occurs across borders throughout the world around the clock such worldwide trading networks offer vast new investment opportunities but could strain the sec ability enforce securities laws and guard investors from fraud under the leadership shad the sec eased financial disclosure requirements for publicly traded companies eliminated many minor investor protection rules attempted spur competition among exchanges and streamlined the agency review hostile corporate takeovers shad who had been vice chairman the hutton investment banking firm brought wall street perspective the agency upon being named chairman line with the views other top administration officials favored marketplace determination takeover battles over new federal regulations the sec under shad also stressed prosecution insider trading violations over the corporate wrongdoing cases that topped the agency enforcement agenda during the administration president jimmy carter democrat securities lawyers and industry officials acquainted with ruder say the new chairman designate unlikely significantly alter the commission current priorities the sec currently has about employees most them lawyers and annual budget about mln dlrs though that figure likely will significantly higher next year the agency moves beef its enforcement staff the agency one the few the government that actually has taken more money than has spent the past few years because fees charges public companies investment banks and other securities firms regulates the sec structured independent regulatory agency meaning that its five commissioners are appointed the president fixed five year terms and protected from firing for policy differences alone law more than three commissioners may the same political party and the agency prepares its own budget request each year instead leaving this the white house established congress the sec traces its origins the great stock market crash which was attributed large part widespread trading credit and attempted market manipulations large investment firms the agency requires public companies and investment vehicles such mutual funds issue periodic reports their financial condition and disclose changes their condition any time they issue new securities requires brokers dealers and investment banks register with and comply with investor protection rules and polices exchanges and regulates trading practices its first chairman was joseph kennedy industrial magnate who was also the father john kennedy later become the nation president other former chairmen include william douglas who served from until his appointment the supreme court and william casey who served during president nixon first term and was reagan director the central intelligence agency until his death earlier this year reuter

from tipping into recession said lyle gramley chief economist the mortgage bankers association and former federal reserve board official the commerce department said this week that the economy grew real net exports keep recession from happening but close call gramley said federal reserve board governor martha seger told reporters that the apparent strength the pct growth figure was the result all market indicators including spot prices the market and netback values all opec crudes have been firming significantly thus consolidating the opec price structure defined the agreement the conference examined the supply demand outlook for the second half the year and decided that order secure continued firm prices the market opec production during the fourth quarter will equal that the third quarter mln barrels per day bpd distributed into the same national production levels were defined the above mentioned agreement for that quarter furthermore the conference decided establish committee five heads delegation monitor the price evolution the market relation the opec official prices order secure price stability around the opec price structure should there any significant change market prices the committee would immediately call for extraordinary meeting the conference with view deciding the necessary opec production levels during the second half the year which would secure the desired market stability the conference reiterated the necessity member countries strict adherence the agreement signed december both terms official price and national production levels for this purpose the conference decided establish committee three heads delegation undertake visits member countries order motivate them comply with the terms the agreement moreover the conference stressed the necessity the cooperation the oil producing exporting countries outside opec essential prerequisite for lasting market stability the conference therefore decided reinstate the group five heads delegation established the extraordinary meeting the conference april undertake the necessary contacts with those countries the conference observed the continued fall the value the dollar and merger and acquisitions group the new york law firm sullivan and cromwell decided against amending allied sec filing disclose the talks even though they had resulted sales price mln dlrs for the shopping centers said securities law requires takeover target companies promptly disclose such things the sale major assets the day after campeau increased its tender offer pct allied stock from pct and raised its bid dlrs share from dlrs sept allied and partnership headed debartolo began negotiating takeover deal aimed thwarting campeau the sec said kern again decided against disclosing the complaint said debartolo and campeau later engaged bitter battle for control allied with campeau winning out later october when bought block mln shares allied stock pct the total controversial move job when given the tools but when its hands are tied doesn have the authority demand form documents tracking merchandise from source destination said many see true test whether producers and importers countries buy coffee big discount many fear that dealers will buy coffee destined for non member countries discounts and then bring into the falsely labelled according customs officials several green trade	says canadian israeli pacts should spur trade trade representative clayton yeutter said monday that the free trade agreements with canada and israel should help pave the way for liberalizing the global trading system said the canadian and israeli pacts will not set back worldwide reform efforts under the general agreement tariffs and trade gatt some critics feared but help them the gatt talks began year ago punta del este uruguay liberalize the global trading system and include trade agriculture and services such banking yeutter made his remarks israeli trade meeting marking the second year their bilateral accord the canadian pact signed two sides two weeks ago has yet been approved the congress and canadian parliament the two free trade agreements fta would gradually remove tariffs and other barriers cross border trade goods and many services yeutter said the aftermath the canadian and israeli pacts other countries have realized that they want continue have access the world largest market they had better get serious about improving the gatt the pact with israel said gradually increasing shipments both ways and the canadian pact will substantially increase the gross national products both countries yeutter also said the canadian and israeli pacts should serve important precedents for progress gatt yeutter said increasing trade one the keys enhanced political and economic stability around the globe said stronger gatt will enhance prosperity not only for advanced industrial nations but also for other countries that need increase trade order better their standards living yeutter added was important not risk the progress made the israeli and canadian trade pacts resorting protectionism was referring trade legislation pending congress that would force the united states take retaliatory actions against nations with large trade surpluses with the united states the countries practiced unfair trade the legislation was prompted growing trade deficit that hit billion dlrs last year and still rising yeutter said the pressures for congress act were hard resist but the pending legislation would undermine president reagan efforts liberalize the world trade yeutter renewed the threat white house veto said president reagan will veto any bill that contains serious flaws and believe that veto would sustained reuter

money-fx	transatlantic row imperils louvre accord dealers the louvre accord currency stability which has maintained uneasy calm currency markets since last february appeared serious danger today transatlantic dispute over west german interest rates came the boil foreign exchange dealers said but the dollar slid against the mark and world stock and bond markets plunged officials the major industrial countries played down the dispute bilateral problem between the united states and west germany and insisted that the currency pact was still alive treasury secretary james baker sparked the market fears when attacked the rise west german short term interest rates that not keeping with the spirit what agreed recently earlier this month washington baker said television interview sunday was referring the meetings finance ministers from the group seven leading industrial nations which reaffirmed the pact under the louvre accord west germany and japan who both have large trade surpluses pledged boost their economic growth take more exports from the while the agreed stop talking the dollar down however baker said saturday that while the louvre agreement was still operative the west german interest rate move would force the examine the accord the foreign exchange market has been told baker that going hammer germany has just declared all bets are off terms currency cooperation chris johns currency analyst ubs phillips and drew london said but bank japan official took much more sanguine view telling reuters that the exchange market apparently reacting too much and anyone who sold the dollar the baker comment will regret later french finance minister edouard balladur who hosted the louvre meeting was the only one the finance ministers respond directly baker remarks called for faithful and firm adherence all the major industrial countries the louvre accords both their letter and spirit neither the west german finance ministry nor the british treasury commented the row but japanese finance ministry official said that despite frustration over higher interest rates abroad this does not represent its readiness scrap the basic framework the louvre accord frankfurt wilhelm christians joint chief executive west germany largest bank deutsche bank said that following recent meetings with baker believed that the was still committed the accord move which the market interpreted possible gesture reconciliation the bundesbank added short term liquidity the west german money market pct monday down from the pct level which injected medium term liquidity last week the bank france also stepped into the french money market hold down rates injecting short term liquidity pct after rates rose close eight pct reuter
